title.narrative: Strengthening institutional capacity to coordinate national anti-trafficking response including the identification, protection of victims, investigation and prosecution of trafficking offenders in Mali

description.narrative: The International Organization for Migration (IOM) will train investigators, prosecutors, and judges on victim-centered TIP investigations and prosecutions, and will seek to institutionalize a national TIP referral mechanism and Standard Operating Procedures between national authorities and service providers (including civil society) to ensure comprehensive victim protection. IOM will work with government of Mali counterparts to ensure successful implementation of the National Action Plan (NAP), which was adopted in 2015. The grant will refurbish two shelters for victims of trafficking, and will provide direct assistance such as counseling, return, and reintegration services for victims of trafficking.
